TopicTitle: Any way to cheat in experience?

Articles.Content: One mod deleted all of my kerbals experience in my career mode and i can't find anything in the persistence file... is there any way to cheat levels in?

Seems suspicious. Anyway, looking through the persistent.sfs it seems that the experience is computed in-game from the CAREER_LOG under ROSTER. You'd probably need to construct imaginary flights in there like this for example:

                                0 = Flight,Kerbin
				0 = Suborbit,Kerbin
				0 = Orbit,Kerbin
				0 = Escape,Kerbin
				0 = Orbit,Sun
				0 = Escape,Duna
				0 = Orbit,Duna
				0 = Escape,Ike
				0 = Orbit,Ike
				0 = Suborbit,Ike
				0 = Land,Ike
				0 = ExitVessel,Ike
				0 = PlantFlag,Ike
				0 = BoardVessel,Ike
				0 = Suborbit,Duna
				0 = Flight,Duna
				0 = Land,Duna
				0 = ExitVessel,Duna
				0 = PlantFlag,Duna
				0 = BoardVessel,Duna
				0 = Escape,Mun
				0 = Land,Kerbin
				0 = Recover

I've never done it before so I'm not sure but you can try it.
Yeah, I did that to test scientist and engineer levels. You can just add the flights for the amount of xp you want to the end of the list.

One mod deleted all of my kerbals experience in my career mode and i can't find anything in the persistence file... is there any way to cheat levels in?

Which mod?
I don't know, but the version of ActiveTextureManagement CKAN gave me corrupts things for some reason...
